posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You say you are Elf/Drow, but you also say that you're Human. A Human would have another feat at level 1.

Without Blind Fight, you would have a big disadvantage against concealed enemies, so I would take it at level 1 instead of Luck of Heroes. The rest of the feats are good choices, but I would take them in a different order. Weapon Finesse is perfect where it is, but I would move Weapon Focus to a level 6. I would move Curse Song to level 15, and I am leaning towards taking Lingering Song at level 9 and then Extend Spell at level 12, but swapping those the other way might work, too.

You say you want to use KD, but you don't have it in your build. If you take 2 levels of Fighter, you would have 2 more feats, which could be KD and IKD.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Well, one way to get both Extend and Still would be to not take an exotic weapon, but (because Bard doesn't give the martial weapons feat either) that would restrict what you could wield quite significantly.

However, with a couple of Fighter levels you'd get 2 more bonus feats, as Empyre says, and automatic martial weapons ability. With even 1 level of Fighter you'd be free to focus in any martial weapon and still have an extra bonus feat. And if you went for a Dex build rather than a Str one, 2 levels of Fighter would allow for both Finesse and the two spelly feats.

But...and it's a big but (no sniggering, please), as Mick's Bard Guide says, level 16 bard song is the sweet spot, and you'd miss out on that.

So, again, it depends how you want to play...

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Sorry, Squid, probably my fault. Bard only gets simple weapons proficiency, so it would either be a matter of taking a feat in martial or in exotic to widen your horizons as far as weapon choices go. However, with that level or 2 of Fighter you automatically gain martial weapons proficiency as a feat, so you have a wider scope of weapons you can focus in without losing a feat, so enabling taking both Extend and Still Spell  and having a spare feat for IKD or whatever - or indeed in a Dex-based build getting weapon finesse and the two spell-related feats.

I hope this makes more sense for you.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Right, the selection of either Still OR Extend spell rests in your playing style Squid. Generally, it depends on your knowledge of your environment too. If you know the module/PW well enough, you can buff beforehand with extended buffs (extended haste is crucial in low-level PW's, disregard this if perma-haste is available) and then wear your armour & go to battle. If you don't, then it is better to have the ability to cast any spell while protected to the fullest. Your armour class is fine if you buff your dexterity a little bit, remember, you have your spells in addition to the items available in your PW.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A level 16 song is a fine thing. But it requires a modified perform rank of 30. A level 16 build can "only" take 19 ranks. You get a +2-3 bonus from charisma 14-15-16. The skill focus feat adds +3 and the artist feat adds +2. So no matter what, you depend on items with skill bonus perform to get a level 16 song.
A level 15 song only needs a perform rank of 24, and a level 14 song perform 21.
Both bard 14 and bard 15 have access to level 5 spells and can extend or still level 4 spells. Bard 16 has access to level 6 spells, but gets no slots for them unless you have a very high charisma or get items with level 6 bonus slots.
What I say is that you may want to multiclass with 1 or 2 levels of another class.
Fighter is a good alternative for a strength build.
For a dexterity build I would look at 2 levels of shadowdancer, assassin or barbarian for uncanny dodge.
